The use of rollers instead of sliding elements reduces frictional forces and makes the mechanism less likely to fail. The lower part count of the system makes it cheaper and more robust. The opening of the channel carrying the guide elements or rollers faces the floor, reducing the likelihood of dirt entering and interfering with the mechanism.

The text goes on to describe the structure of the support assembly, including leg assemblies pivotally connected to the deck support frame and actuators for moving the legs and hence the frame. The text also mentions the use of stabilizer

The text describes a reflectance measurement apparatus for measuring the reflectance of skin, specifically designed to overcome the problem of color influence and the need for accurate positioning. The apparatus comprises a probe with a flexible connection in fiber optics, a measuring device with light emitting and receiving means, and a processing device. The use of fiber optics and a flexible connection allows for miniaturization, easy handling, and measurement on small surfaces, while the correction of light intensity and ambient light variations ensures accurate measurements. The resulting reflectance value is a relative value, which can be displayed and used for various applications such as cosmetology and pathology.

This invention relates to a dental apparatus that provides hydraulic cleaning of teeth and massaging of gums. The apparatus consists of a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members, joined by membranes and pneumatic means to move the channel members and massage the gums. Hydraulic means is also provided for cleaning and lubricating the teeth and gingival crevices. The mouthpiece fits snugly over the teeth and gums, and the apparatus can be operated with or without water and in various modes using a control box or a remote control device.

The text describes a pelvic floor reconstruction invention that uses implants and a needle for threading straps through ligaments from the accessible side. The needle includes a trap for trapping the strap and a mechanism for releasing it, allowing threading from the accessible side. The anterior and posterior implants are used for reconstructing various organs and include straps threaded into ligaments and loops for anchoring to the cervix or perineal body. The needle design enables threading through ligaments without requiring additional perforations from the opposing direction.

The text describes a method and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance to subjects with respiratory needs, including those who are spontaneously or non-spontaneously breathing. The invention aims to match the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts, maintain a minimum ventilation without relying on chemoreflexes, and work correctly in the presence of leaks. The text discusses the limitations of simple home ventilators and servo-ventilators, and introduces proportional assist ventilation (PAV) as a potential solution. However, PAV has disadvantages, including the calculation of volume based on the integral of flow, which can lead to overestimation in the presence of leaks, and reliance on the subject's chemoreflexes to set the level of spontaneous effort. The text proposes a method for calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable using fuzzy logic, and a method for providing ventilatory assistance based on this calculation. The invention also includes a method for calculating average respiratory rate and a method for providing ventilatory assistance in a spontaneously breathing subject.

The text describes an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use in laparoscopic procedures, which includes a rigid insulating sleeve surrounding a conducting rod that extends from a proximal plug to a distal end. The distal end includes a rigid arm extending from the sleeve, with a working tip electrode integrated at its free end. The arm and working tip electrode are electrically conductive and supplied electrical energy via the conductive rod. A thin insulating jacket covers the arm from the sleeve to the base of the working tip electrode. The invention's novel feature is the inclusion of an arm extending between the working tip electrode and the sleeve, which reduces the obstruction of the surgeon's view of the operation site caused by the relatively large diameter of the sleeve. The arm includes portions laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve, increasing the visualization of the surgical work site. The instrument comes in various working tip electrode shapes, such as a hook and a flattened spatula. The arm's length and configuration allow for significant spacing and lateral offset of the working tip electrode from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve, enhancing the surgeon's view of the surgical work site.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, and transmit and receive coils, allowing exposures in two predetermined positions with specific adjustment parameters. The required adjustment parameters are determined in a preceding adjustment process and stored until the examination's conclusion. The support plate's position and coil configurations are inputs to the adjustment unit, which outputs control signals to the generator, amplifiers, receiver, and shim coil system. Larger body segments can be examined, such as in subtraction angiography, without the need for new adjustments or multiple injections of contrast agent. The adjustment process precedes the exposure process, resulting in high-contrast exposures and reduced examination times.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a releasable fastener for albums with front and back covers and removable pages. It includes a pair of strap anchors, one for each cover, a strap that passes through aligned apertures in the covers and album pages, and means for providing a releasable connection between the strap and each anchor. The strap anchors are in the form of channels with snap locks to securely hold the strap. The strap is snap-locked into the channel by snapping engagement beneath locking lips, and the base of the channel and the strap have inter-engaging formations to prevent longitudinal displacement. The invention provides a more positive locking system with multiple pairs of locking lips. The strap enters the channel via an aperture bordered by a projection to ensure correct location between the strap anchor and the cover. The fastener allows for easy insertion and removal of pages while accommodating a variable thickness of the album. The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the covers.
</summary>

The text describes a new type of fastener for albums with front and back covers and removable pages. The fastener includes a pair of strap anchors, a strap, and a means for providing a releasable connection between the strap and each anchor. The strap anchors are in the form of channels with snap locks to securely hold the strap. The strap is snap-locked into the channel by snapping engagement beneath locking lips, and the base of the channel and the strap have inter-engaging formations to prevent longitudinal displacement. The invention provides a more positive locking system with multiple pairs of locking lips. The strap enters the channel via an aperture bordered by a projection to ensure correct location between the strap anchor and the cover. The fastener allows for easy insertion and removal of pages while accommodating a variable thickness of the album. The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the covers.

The present invention describes a new sulky design that can be manufactured using lightweight and durable materials such as aluminum or reinforced plastics, allowing for easy assembly from flat elements and reduced manufacturing costs through casting and mass production. The design features shafts fastened to the frame in the planes of the wheels, enabling avoidance of traditional welding processes and integration of details in the casting process. The sulky also has a stable construction and can be easily assembled by the user with ordinary hand tools. The design results in a weight reduction of approximately 40% and allows for an inexpensive and individual color display system.

The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds in water-cooled generators, specifically addressing the issue of air bubbles accumulating in rotating pipes and reducing cooling efficiency. The invention provides at least one bypass with inlets and outlets between the feed and discharge ducts, with at least one inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation. This arrangement utilizes the pressure gradient between the inflow and outflow for automatic operation, and allows for a relatively simple design. The bypass can be arranged in the end face of the feed duct, or as a radially arranged pipe or coiled pipe. The bypass may also include means for increasing hydrodynamic resistance to achieve an adequate pressure drop over a short distance. The invention eliminates air bubbles by providing inlets in the space around the axis of rotation, where they accumulate due to the lowest pressure point.

The text describes a steering column for motor vehicles that includes a jacket unit rotatably supporting the steering shaft and a retaining part. The jacket unit is connected to the retaining part across an energy absorption connection and a break-away connection. The energy absorption connection comprises at least one bending wire or strip that is deformed during a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part, while the break-away connection is released if a limit value of force is exceeded. The invention also relates to a method for producing such a steering column. The text also mentions various prior art steering columns and their disadvantages, and explains how the invention addresses these issues by decreasing the force peak during the break-away of the jacket unit from the retaining part. The steering column is adjustable in length and height or inclination, and the retaining part is formed by a part of the securement device. The energy absorption device for enabling the energy absorbing dislocation of the jacket unit in the event of a crash is integrated into the securement device. The securement part, which is nondisplaceable with respect to the bracket unit in the direction parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft, moves simultaneously with the jacket unit during the displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the bracket unit. The securement part and the retaining part come in different length settings of the steering column in different positions into mutual contact when the securement device is closed, and the displacement of the retaining part with respect to the securement part is counteracted by securement elements cooperating under form closure. The height or inclination of the steering column is also settable in the opened state of the securement device. The break-away connection between the retaining part and the jacket unit can be formed by a pin or a frictional closure connection, and the bending wire or strip is at least partially enclosed in a housing formed by a portion of the jacket unit.

The present invention describes a method for installing flat, uncontoured glass panels in curved window openings of vehicles by using resilient clips and a reveal molding to hold and flex the glass into place, allowing for the application of adhesive sealant to permanently secure the glass in the curved window opening. This process eliminates the need for expensive pre-contoured glass and reduces the overall cost of glass installation.

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus for removing gas from a liquid, particularly for separating oxygen from water on offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms. The invention aims to provide a mechanical, cylindrical gas scavenger machine with a reduced height compared to a stripping tower and a sump for chemical scavenger treatment. The apparatus includes a vessel with partitions dividing it into gasification chambers, each with a vapor space and a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid to displace the first gas and create a turbulent area. A vent in each chamber removes gas and liquid. The second gas is introduced via an external connection and displaces the first gas, scavenging oxygen from the water without chemically displacing it. The number of gasification chambers is sufficient to reduce the concentration of the first gas to the desired level. The method is a continuous process, and the amount of second gas ingestion is controlled based on rotor submergence and speed. The apparatus may include a liquid level controller and a programmable logic controller for controlling liquid levels in the gasification chambers. The invention offers decreased vessel height requirements and reduced capital costs.
</summary>

The apparatus may include a liquid level controller and a programmable logic controller for controlling liquid levels in the gasification chambers. The invention offers decreased vessel height

<summary>
The text describes a packaging machine with a rotational shaft arranged in the production direction, which drives movable tool members of various work stations through transfer mechanisms. This synchronizes the movements of the tool members and simplifies the design of the packaging machine. The transfer mechanism can be a cam mechanism or an arrangement of toggle levers, and can include wear-reducing elements. The shaft can be driven in a continuous or alternating rotation. The packaging machine may have multiple work stations, some of which can be arranged on different vertical levels for a more compact design.
</summary>

The transfer mechanism can be a cam mechanism or an arrangement of toggle levers, and can include wear-reducing elements. The shaft can be driven in a continuous or alternating rotation. The packaging machine may have multiple work stations, some of which can be arranged on different vertical levels for a more compact design.

<summary>
The text describes a disposable finishing article, such as a grinding wheel, with a permanently affixed mounting hub. The hub includes a backing flange with gripping means and a retaining nut with a radial flange and protrusion for securing the flange and nut together without adhesives. A pressure cap is held in place by the gripping means and engages the power tool spindle seat to compress the finishing article during use. The assembly is lightweight, vibration-free, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles, and can accommodate various sizes of grinding wheels.
</summary>

The text discusses a disposable finishing article, such as a grinding wheel, with a permanently affixed mounting hub. The hub includes a backing flange with a smaller diameter than the wheel and a central aperture aligned with the wheel's aperture. The flange has reinforcing ribs and gripping means, such as fingers, formed in the outer surface. A retaining nut is inserted through the wheel and flange, and its end is upset to form a protrusion that secures the nut and flange together without adhesives. A pressure cap snaps onto the hub and engages the spindle seat on the power tool, compressing the finishing article during use. The assembly is lightweight, vibration-free, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles, and can accommodate various sizes of grinding wheels.

The text describes three exemplary embodiments of a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system. The first embodiment includes a housing block, a motor, a housing, and a covering hood. Pressure fluid entrained by the piston pumps drips into the spring chambers, which are located away from electrical components, preventing water intrusion and the need for permeable elements or check valves. The second embodiment is similar but includes a central component that supports the motor shaft and requires a sealing strip to prevent pressure fluid from reaching the motor threads. The third embodiment uses the housing block from the second embodiment and achieves pressure equilibrium between the cam element chamber and the motor interior through an annular conduit portion surrounding the shaft. This design eliminates the need for certain openings, reducing production costs. All three embodiments prevent water intrusion while allowing for pressure equalization and the diversion of pressure fluid away from electrical components.

The text describes an invention for a power and free conveyor system that allows for efficient and selective transfer of carriers between predetermined paths. The system uses a third dog in addition to the first and second dogs, which are normally held out of operative position by the track but can be moved to operative position to transfer the carrier across short or long distances. The second and third dogs have cam projections that engage portions of the track, and as the carrier moves to a transfer zone, one or the other of the second and third dogs is successively moved to operative position. The system can be used for both short and long distance transfers and can be adapted to various conveyor configurations. The dogs are held down by the track when not in use and are pivoted down when needed for transfer.

The text describes an invention for a conductive railroad car center plate assembly bowl liner made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) specially mixed with conductive material such as carbon black. This liner eliminates the need for additional grounding apparatus and provides self-lubricating properties. The liner is designed to fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate, limiting lost motion movement and providing vertical support. The preferred flat horizontal disk liner has a conductive ring and an outer ring composed of UHMW-PE, while the full bowl liner has a conductive ring molded into the plastic and an outer ring composed of structural self-lubricating plastic. Both designs meet the required coefficient of friction and electrical conductivity standards.

<summary>
The invention described herein is a gate valve designed for controlling the dispensing of viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches, particularly in situations where one hand is needed to hold the receiving vessel. The valve consists of a spout insert mounting sleeve with a passage extending through it and a discharge outlet with a sealing edge. A gate valve guide member is integrated with the sleeve and extends radially outward to guide the gate valve during its reciprocal movement. The gate valve itself is a curved plate with channel-formations on its edges that fit into the guide plate, drawing the plates tightly together. The gate valve is reciprocated on the guide member by an integral extension with flat-finger and split lugs. The valve can be easily mounted on the spout of a bag by guiding the tapered sleeve into the spout and securing it with the interior surfaces of the spout. The valve can be actuated with one hand by engaging the lugs on the guide member and the gate valve with fingers, moving them together to open or close the valve. The valve functions in inclined positions and can be easily disassembled for cleaning.
</summary>

The text describes a vehicular rearview mirror system that is adaptable to different vehicle control protocols. The system includes a mirror control responsive to the output of the vehicle control, which determines the protocol and generates a mirror control output. The mirror control may be a microcomputer that uses software processing to determine the protocol. The system can be used with various types of vehicle control outputs, such as gear status information or door status information, and can control lighting assemblies associated with the mirror assemblies.

<summary>
The text describes an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles with an anti-dive device and a damped telescopic front suspension. The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and reduces the dive effect during braking. The system consists of a hydraulic pump, a modulator, a pressure discharge valve, and a sensor. The hydraulic pump is driven by the front wheel when braking, and the modulator regulates the hydraulic pressure to the front wheel brakes. The pressure discharge valve is opened when the front wheel is about to lock, and the sensor detects the nearly-locked condition of the front wheel. The system also includes a damped telescopic front suspension to reduce the vibration of the chassis during braking. The anti-dive device is achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel. The system improves braking efficiency and reduces the vibration of the chassis.
</summary>

The text describes an improved partition system for refrigerated trailers, which includes at least two panels that can be moved independently using a rail and trolley system. The panels can be slidably attached to the rails and hingedly attached to the trolley assembly, allowing them to be raised and secured to the ceiling when not in use. The system enables the creation of multiple cargo areas with different temperatures by dividing the trailer into zones using center and lateral panels.

The text describes an invention of a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography systems, specifically for simulated moving bed (SMB) counter-current operations. The valve allows for the contact faces of the rotor and stator to be partially separated and flushed with sanitizing fluid without the need for disassembly, ensuring the sterile condition of the process system. The valve design includes a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm molded to the rotor, which forms multiple sealing ports and tubular ducts leading to sanitary piping flanges. The diaphragm also has a flexible wiping lip seal to maintain fluid-tight sealing engagement with the stator during cross flushing. The invention also includes a process for forming the rotary valve diaphragm seal in place using insert molding.

The text describes an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays in process columns, specifically for cross-flow trays. The invention includes a plurality of apertures formed in the tray having a valve cover mounted thereon, with the first leg of the valve being wider than the second leg and disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray. The legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions thereof for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow. The valve shapes include oval and triangular designs, and the valve includes means for selectively biasing the rear region of the valve upwardly against the flow of liquid for facilitating initial, directionalized vapor flow therethrough. The invention also includes an improved method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer of a process column onto an underlying cross-flow tray, using directional thrust valves disposed therein. The valves are formed of generally circular disc members disposed above circular apertures formed within the tray, with the first leg being wider than the second leg for directing flow therearound, and the first and second legs of the valve being disposed along a line perpendicular to the downcomer and generally parallel to the flow therefrom. The method also includes forming the first and second legs of the valve with flange portions outstanding from the disc and engaging the underside of the tray to prevent the lifting of the valve upwardly therethrough, and forming the circular aperture with first and second notches therein, the first and second notches receiving the first and second legs therein and preventing the rotation of the disc relative to the tray.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. It reduces pressure variances and is inexpensive, lightweight, and portable. The assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor for converting fluid pressure into mechanical power, a transfer line, a fluid regulator, and an output line. The vane motor is coupled to a generator that converts mechanical power into electrical energy. The regulator is used to regulate the pressure of the fluid exiting the assembly. The vane motor extracts work from the pressurized fluid while reducing its pressure, allowing the use of a smaller or more inexpensive regulator. Any desired motor and generator can be used, and multiple motors and generators can be employed to recover work from a pressurized fluid.
</summary>

The text describes a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. This invention reduces pressure variances, is inexpensive, lightweight, and portable. The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor for converting fluid pressure into mechanical power, a transfer line, a fluid regulator, and an output line. The vane motor is coupled to a generator that converts mechanical power into electrical energy. The regulator regulates the pressure of the fluid exiting the assembly. The vane motor extracts work from the pressurized fluid while reducing its pressure, allowing the use of a smaller or more inexpensive regulator. Any desired motor and generator can be used, and multiple motors and generators can be employed to recover work from a pressurized fluid.

The text describes a pallet system that includes a pallet base and a pallet cap, which together form a pallet. The pallet system has raised, parallel guide rails on the top surface of the pallet cap, which help to position and interlock trays. The trays have side supports that closely straddle the guide rails, limiting their lateral movement. End plates are vertically positioned at the ends of the pallet to secure the load and provide rigidity to the stack of trays. The pallet system allows trays to be slid on and off, and is suitable for automated loading and unloading.

<summary>
The present invention pertains to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension in the field of aviation aircrafts. The limited internal space of the saucer shell necessitates a compact design with a reasonable layout, small weight, high motive power conversion efficiency, and easily manipulated and controlled rotary-wing system and power system. The rotary-wing system consists of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in the space restricted by the electromotive ring, magnetic suspension shaft, and magnetic suspension guide rail using magnetic suspension radial and axial bearings. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, and magnetic suspension shaft form a magnetic suspension electric engine. Two sets of independent magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems can be superposed and mounted coaxially inside the saucer shell in either the axial or radial direction to improve the design and overcome the reactive torque generated during rotation.
</summary>

The text describes an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which aims to make full use of the limited internal space of the saucer shell and design a rotary-wing system and power system with a compact structure, reasonable layout, small weight, high motive power conversion efficiency, and easy manipulation and control. The rotary-wing system consists of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft using magnetic suspension radial and axial bearings. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, and magnetic suspension shaft form a magnetic suspension electric engine. Two sets of independent magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems can be superposed and mounted coaxially inside the saucer shell in either the axial or radial direction to improve the design and overcome the reactive torque generated during rotation. The radial magnetic suspension structure uses repulsive forces between magnets on the magnetic suspension inner ring and shaft to suspend the wheels in the radial direction. The axial magnetic suspension structure uses repulsive forces between magnets on the magnetic suspension inner ring and guide rail to suspend the wheels in the axial direction. The electric engine can be designed as a permanent magnet synchronous engine, which is simple,

The text describes an invention related to streptavidin muteins, which are modified forms of streptavidin with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands. The invention involves the production of these proteins using recombinant DNA technology, and their use for the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances, particularly other recombinant proteins. The text explains that the importance of the biotin/streptavidin system in molecular biology has increased significantly, and that the use of peptide ligands as alternatives to biotin for binding to streptavidin has been sought to expand its range of applications. The text also mentions that the peptide ligand system has advantages such as allowing for the purification of recombinant proteins under mild elution conditions and enabling their detection using streptavidin conjugates. However, the system has a relatively low affinity, and the objective of the invention was to optimize it with regard to binding strength. The text goes on to describe how the binding affinity for the streptavidin/peptide ligand system was improved by mutation in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53 of streptavidin.

The text describes a method for synthesizing substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, specifically nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina. The method involves reacting guanylating agents, such as thioureas and isothioureas, with amines or pyrrolidines in the presence of the nickel catalyst. The nickel catalysts are preferably in the zero oxidation state and present at less than 10 molar % nickel based on the total moles of guanylating agent(s). The method provides high yields of substituted guanidines and is advantageous due to the relatively inexpensive cost and complete recoverability of the nickel catalysts.

The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires, involving an anodic oxidation bath for forming an oxide film on the aluminum and an electrolytic coloring bath for coloring the oxide film using a specific acid or water-soluble metal salt. The method provides a colored oxide film with high weatherability or fade resistance without requiring a large amount of electrical energy. The apparatus includes a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath with a cathode, an electrolytic coloring bath with an anode, an electric circuit for connecting the cathode and anode to a power source, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire through the baths. The anodic oxidation bath composition includes sulfuric acid and optional additives, while the electrolytic coloring bath contains a nickel salt, cobalt salt, copper salt, tin salt, or selenious acid and may include additional components for controlling conductivity and pH. The current density and electrolytic period in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion. The aluminum strip or wire functions as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath and is electrolyzed by direct current. The apparatus can be used to produce aluminum strips or wires with colored oxide films having excellent weatherability or fade resistance for various applications.

The text describes a process for assembling a DNA sequence of interest in planta using two or more precursor vectors through site-specific DNA recombination, allowing for the optimization and identification of the sequence for stable nuclear transformation of plant cells. The process can be used for screening libraries of coding or regulatory sequences, designing safer vectors, and avoiding difficult cloning of complex DNA regions. The choice of a suitable promoter for the recombinase is crucial for the efficiency of the assembly process. The vectors can be delivered to plants using various methods, including Agrobacterium-mediated transformation, particle bombardment, or other techniques.

The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a coated aluminum swash plate having a heat curable, cross-linked coating of a polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to the aluminum, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive. The coating allows the use of low silicon alloy aluminum without the need for metal plating or high finish polishing. The coating is applied in an aqueous spray and cured in an oven at an elevated temperature. The piston shoe may also be coated with the fluorocarbon coating. The coating increases the durability and reduces the coefficient of friction of the swash plate, improving the efficiency of the compressor. The coating is preferred for use on non-hypereutectic aluminum and aluminum alloys having less than 10% by weight of silicon. The coating process does not require the high surface finish on the swash plate as compared to traditional methods. The coating exhibits smooth facial and end surfaces, potentially eliminating one or more machining steps in the manufacture of swash plates.

The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, specifically for use in photolithography processes using 193 nm and 248 nm light beams. The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at these wavelengths and can be prepared using reaction equations involving polyhydroxystyrene resin, diazonaphthoquinone halide, and an amine in a solvent. The polymers can be used alone in an organic solvent or in combination with light-absorbing compounds such as anthracene derivatives, fluorenone derivatives, fluorene, and quinizarin. The anti-reflective coating is formed by filtering a solution of the polymer and coating it on a semiconductor wafer, which then undergoes hard-baking to form a cross-linked structure. The polymers have proven to be excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials and have been found to be effective in the formation of submicro-patterns using various light sources.

<summary>
The text describes an invention of a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic. The film has a thickness between 10 and 350 μm and comprises at least one white pigment, at least one flame retardant, and at least one UV absorber. The film is intended to have good orientability, thermoformability, and mechanical and optical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively. The invention also relates to the use of this film and the process for its production. The background of the invention explains that existing white films made from crystallizable thermoplastics lack UV resistance and flame retardancy, and have poor thermoformability and optical properties. The text also mentions the shortcomings of previous attempts to improve the properties of these films using antioxidants and flame-retardant polymers. The objective of the invention is to provide a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film that can be produced cost-effectively and has good orientability, thermoformability, and mechanical and optical properties. The film is intended to pass fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and the UL 94 test, and to have high UV resistance, meaning that it absorbs UV light and does not transmit light until the visible region has been reached. Thermoformability means that the film can be thermoformed to give complex and large-surface-area moldings on commercially available thermoforming machinery, without uneconomic predrying. The film is also intended to have good optical properties, including uniform coloration, high surface gloss, low light transmission, and a Yellowness Index unchanged from that of the flame-retardant and UV-modified film. Good mechanical properties include high modulus of elasticity and good values for tensile stress at break. Good orientability includes the capability of the film to give excellent orientation, both in a longitudinal direction and in a transverse direction, during its production, without break-offs. Cost-effective production includes the capability of the raw materials or raw material components needed to produce the flame-retardant film to be dried using industrial-standard dryers, without caking or becoming thermally de

The text describes various examples of a process for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) through hydrofluorination of 142b (1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane) using different catalysts and conditions. The process involves feeding HF and 142b to a reactor containing a catalyst, such as CrF3 or Cr/Ni/AlF3, and heating it to a specified temperature for a certain contact time to achieve high conversion and selectivity for 143a. The results show that the catalysts are effective in producing 143a with high conversion and selectivity, even in the presence of other impurities like 141b and HCl. The process can be run under adiabatic conditions, and the temperature and contact time can be varied to optimize the performance of the catalyst. The spent catalyst can be regenerated by heating it with air. The text also discusses the removal of low levels of olefinic materials (1130a, 1131a, and 1132a) from 143a using a separate post-reactor containing the same catalyst and lower temperature. The process can be carried out at high pressure using the same catalyst and conditions.

<summary>
This text describes an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3## using hypophosphorous acid. The process improves product yield and reduces unwanted impurities, specifically sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities, in the synthesis of pyrazolotriazoles from their triazolothiadiazine precursors. The process involves reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and pyrazolotriazole. The use of hypophosphorous acid results in the formation of H2S instead of sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities, which are detrimental to the process and can interfere with subsequent reaction steps. The process is straightforward, economical, and readily adaptable by industry.
</summary>

The text explains that pyrazolotriazoles, which are useful magenta couplers for photographic products, are difficult to synthesize and have limited synthetic routes. One common method involves the preparation of triazolothiadiazines and their subsequent desulfurization to pyrazolotriazoles. However, this process generates significant amounts of sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities, which are detrimental to the process and can interfere with subsequent reaction steps.

The invention described in the text provides an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3## using hypophosphorous acid. This process reduces the amount of unwanted impurities, specifically sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities, and improves product yield.

The process involves reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and pyrazolotriazole. The use of hypophosphorous acid results in the formation of H2S instead of sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities. H2S is readily removed from the reaction zone and can be trapped using caustic and sodium hypochlorite.

The process is straightforward, economical, and readily adaptable

The text describes an invention for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types using a method that measures and removes a predetermined partial quantity from each fiber bale individually, ensuring no residual fibers remain and a homogeneous mixture is obtained. The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber lot before each pass and calculating a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion, which is then removed during that pass. The method also includes setting a maximum period for fiber removal from each lot to maintain a determined time schedule and prevent idle run of after-connected processing machines. The apparatus for performing this method includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device.

The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel courses of yarns using a synchronized rake mechanism that accepts and retains yarns between or on needles, allowing for greater assurance of parallelism and the ability to control fabric strength and thickness by overlapping successive courses. The rake mechanism can be angled to correspond to the approaching yarns and can move a fraction of a full course, resulting in partial overlapping of return courses and varying fabric density.

The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom, allowing for stable weft insertion and preventing undue consumption of pressurized air by producing varying weft carrying forces through different subnozzle groups or by supplying air under different pressures or for different intervals of time.

The text describes an invention related to a process for spinning bast fibers, such as jute, kenaf, or hemp, to create flexible and strong bast fiber yarn with low end breakage rates. The process includes twice health preserving the fibers, which involves putting them in specific temperature, humidity conditions for certain durations. The invention also covers a process for blended spinning bast fibers with other fibers, such as cotton, and creating multi-fibre yarn with low end breakage rates. The experiments conducted on jute, kenaf, and hemp fibers, as well as their blends with other fibers, showed significant reductions in end breakage rates compared to existing technologies.

The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses using covered rolls with imbedded sensors. Nip presses are used in various industries, including papermaking, to apply pressure to moving webs for forming materials such as paper, textile, and plastic foil. In papermaking, the nip region is the contact area between two rolls where the paper web passes, and even pressure distribution in this region is crucial for achieving uniform sheet characteristics. Conventional nip presses may have uneven pressure distribution along the roll length, leading to issues such as poor quality paper, excessive pressure, and holes. The present invention provides a method and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile, resulting in a more accurate representation of the true nip pressure profile. The invention uses multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel the effects of rotational variability and obtain a more true measurement of the pressure distribution across the nip region. The data obtained from the arrangement of sensors allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, providing real-time information for obtaining a more accurate nip pressure profile. The invention allows the sensing roll to take multiple pressure measurements at each cross-directional position during each revolution, utilizing the averages of these measurements to calculate and display the nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile.

<summary>
This invention relates to an apparatus for an ironing board that supports an electrical cord of an iron and holds an article, such as a spray starch can or beverage container. The apparatus includes a C-shaped clamp with a pair of leg portions, one engaging the ironing surface and the other adjustable for securing the apparatus to the ironing board. A flexible cord support pivotably attaches to the clamp and supports the electrical cord above the ironing board. An article holder is mounted to the clamp and detachably holds an article. An electrical receptacle is carried by the clamp for receiving the iron's plug. In a preferred embodiment, the clamp has a movable jaw that engages the underside of the ironing board for securing the apparatus. The flexible cord support has a resilient spring section and can be locked in a raised position. The article holder has a pair of tangs that detachably engage openings in a mounting brace.
</summary>

The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can effectively form buttonholes in various materials without causing stitching to fail or overlap. The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly with a slidable member, and an adjustable stop. The slidable member is positionable by a button and carries a tab to actuate the tripping lever on the machine, limiting the length of the buttonhole. The adjustable stop engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point. The device attaches to a presser bar and includes a foot pad with oppositely acting springs that define an initial position for the travelling assembly. The shoe of the travelling assembly includes a gaging element with a tab for actuating the tripping lever and an adjustable stop with a knob for adjusting its position relative to the tab. The operator positions the button between V-notches on the foot pad and gaging element to establish the buttonhole length, and adjusts the screw on the adjustable stop to ensure proper engagement of the tripping lever and formation of a perfect buttonhole. The device allows for easy adjustment when sewing buttonholes in different materials.

The text describes an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, which includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The conveyor is an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path. The liquid applicator is located at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion. The suction device is located at a second station along the path for removing the liquid from the web by suction during motion. The dwell stretch is located between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop. The apparatus allows for effective washing without stacking the textile web or running it through a vat, and is especially advantageous for printed materials. The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass or a freely rotating drum, and the textile web is guided with little tension. The suction device is disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt and causes the web to adhere to the belt and be entrained by it, reducing longitudinal tensile stresses in the web. The apparatus can have a compact construction and is suitable for soilage washing and fastness treatment.

The text describes a dry cleaning machine with an air flow system for inducing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, while minimizing the loss of expensive, volatile solvent vapors. The machine includes a separate intake fan and duct with a valve that isolates the intake system from the solvent vapors during normal operation. When the door is opened, the intake fan is energized and the valve opens, allowing air to flow into the interposed duct and directly into the access opening, while minimizing the loss of vapors within the tubs. The solvent flow system continuously filters and recirculates the solvent throughout the machine during the fill and wash portions of the cycle, while the drain and spin portions of the cycle dump the solvent from the tubs back into the storage tank. The air flow system prevents air circulation through the tubs during the spin cycle to minimize the formation of unwanted streaks and swales. During the drying portion of the cycle, the air and vapor mixture exits the tubs through a lint box and is heated before being recirculated through the tubs to vaporize the solvent. The vapor is then condensed and returned to the storage tank. The refrigeration system cools the storage tank to maintain the solvent at a predetermined temperature and condenses the solvent vapors during the dry portion of the cycle. The controls allow for a modified dry operation to dry the filter cartridges prior to replacement, while preventing the tub from rotating or advancing the timer to other portions of the cycle.

The text describes a new method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly for melt spun nonwoven webs, using a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width. The system harnesses the positive aspects of both eductive and non-eductive systems while solving problems such as spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control. The invention also incorporates aspects of the meltblown process to improve web formation control. The system uses a thermoplastic polymer in fluid condition for spinning, which is then quenched with air or other cooling fluid and drawn through a narrowing lower end of the quench chamber into the impingement point slot opening. The filaments are then transported to a web forming table to create a non-woven web. The system is flexible and can accommodate a wide variety of materials and operating conditions.

In this document, several embodiments of a sewing machine are described, which enable easily setting a position on a work cloth for sewing without the need to affix markers. The first embodiment uses ultrasonic waves to detect the position of the pen tip of an ultrasonic pen on the work cloth and calculate the corresponding coordinates. The second embodiment uses an embroidery unit with receivers to detect the ultrasonic waves and transmit the detection information to the sewing machine. The third embodiment uses an electromagnetic wave output circuit in the ultrasonic pen to transmit a signal to the sewing machine, which can detect the transmission timing and calculate the coordinates. The fourth embodiment uses multiple receivers on the sewing machine to detect the ultrasonic waves and calculate the coordinates without the need for transmission timing information. The receivers and ultrasonic pen can be provided in various positions on the sewing machine or embroidery unit to satisfy certain conditions for accurate position detection.

The present invention relates to methods and preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials, specifically cotton, linen, or other natural fibers, by applying functional additives. The stability and performance of textile articles made from cellulosic fabric materials with functional additives have been found to be unsatisfactory, particularly in regards to ultraviolet protection and anti-bacterial properties. Therefore, the invention provides improved methods for applying functional additives to cellulosic fabric materials using ultrafine wool powder or ultrafine bamboo powder as carriers. The ultrafine wool powder has exceptional carrying and retention ability for functional additives, and the ultrafine bamboo powder improves moisture management properties. The preparations are made by pulverizing the wool or bamboo fibers and forming a suspension, which is then mixed with functional additives and a binder. The preparations can be applied to the fabric by printing, padding, or foam application. The invention also provides a method for preparing ultrafine bamboo powder from bamboo fibers. The functional additives can include ultraviolet protection agents, anti-bacterial agents, or other useful properties. The ultrafine wool powder or bamboo powder can have a size of 200 nm or below and a helical structure capable of carrying functional additives. The binding agent can be an acrylic copolymer based, aqueous dispersed binder. The carrier agent can be wool particles or wool powder of macrofibril size and below. The functional additives can be in ultrafine powder form and have a nano-sized particle size. The non-charcoal fibrous bamboo powder can be ultrafine and have a particle size of less than 1 μm. The method for preparing the preparation can include pulverizing the wool or bamboo fibers, adding a wetting agent and forming a suspension, and then pulverizing the fibers in the suspension to create ultrafine particles. The preparation can be applied to the fabric to provide enhanced moisture management, wicking, and wrinkling resistance properties.

The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for specialized quilting of patterns using a separate process controller for table movement and a separate computer for sewing machine functions, allowing for independent programming and simplified reprogramming. The machine includes a frame quilting table that can move in the X and Y directions, a sewing machine head with its own computer, and a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns.

The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image, using a support layer or scrim sandwiched between two precursor webs and subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device. The use of a support layer improves the fabric's performance and allows for enhanced imaging. The fabric can be made from staple length fibers or continuous filaments, and the fibrous matrices on each side can be dissimilar. The fabric may also include apertures and can be used in various applications, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and industrial products. The fabric's unique properties on each side are maintained due to the intermediate water-pervious support layer.

The invention describes a device for a sewing machine that includes a guide chute for a strip of material, a stop in the feed path of the strip that is displaceable and connectable to the sewing machine to control its operation based on the position of the stop and the strip material. The device aims to provide a simple, rugged, and economical sewing machine control for feeding strip materials to a workpiece.

The invention describes a method for connecting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine, allowing for the end portions to be joined in a knitted state without the need for separate sewing processes, increasing productivity and reducing manufacturing costs. The method involves overlaying and binding off loops of the two knit pieces across the boundary, gradually decreasing the number of loops until they are connected.

The text describes an invention related to a flexible traction element for passenger and goods lifts, consisting of at least one stranded cable made of a material ensuring tensile strength, which is wound and unwound. The invention also includes a production line for embedding multiple stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic plastics material, featuring a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater for preheating, at least one extruder for co-extrusion, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller. The method for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material is also part of the invention. U.S. Pat. No. 3,348,585 and GB 1362514 are referenced as related art. The objective is to increase flexibility and improve long-term adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket, while precisely controlling the spacing of the stranded cables for guaranteed tensile strength. The production line can be used for individual or multiple stranded cables and can be adjusted to ensure precise positioning within the jacket. The method involves degreasing and preheating the stranded cables before embedding them in the plastics material, which results in improved adhesion and long-term durability.

The text describes a new rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine that aims to minimize the impediment of the needle thread loop during its guiding around the bobbin housing. The arrangement includes a spring rod and cams on opposite sides of a projection of the bobbin housing, with the holding means located on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing. The needle thread loop can expand freely until its maximum expansion is reached, and then be pulled back unhindered through the stitch hole. A capsule release device can be used to eliminate the slight impediment caused by the bending of the spring rod, reducing the required needle thread tension to a minimum.

The text describes a patent application related to methods and materials for producing silicon-based micro and nanofibers using electrospinning techniques. Liquid silanes, such as cyclohexasilane, are used as precursors and are transformed directly into nanowires during the electrospinning process. The use of electrospinning allows for the management of stresses that can lead to microstructural changes and cracking in larger silicon structures. The resulting silicon-based fibers can be used in various applications, including as components in composite materials and electrodes. The patent application also discusses the use of different solvents, polymers, and solid phase components in the ink formulations and the effects of thermal and laser processing on the resulting materials.

The text describes an invention for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a controller with a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension-responsive braking element. The tensioning lever, coupled to the braking element, engages and is biased by the threads, occupying an angular position dependent on thread tension and weight. A biasing arrangement, activated by fluid pressure, influences the tensioning lever to alter thread tension for the entire creel. The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, allowing for central control of thread tension and rapid braking when the warping machine is shut off. The biasing arrangement is preferably a piston/cylinder assembly, and the tensioning lever ensures that the braking shoe, which can be held by the tensioning lever, is removed from contact with the further braking surface upon restart of the warping machine.

The present invention provides a sewing machine detector with flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that detect sewing machine speed, needle UP and DOWN positions, and thread trimmer timing position, using light transmitted through optical fibers and reflected by stationary reflecting portions. The detector is less expensive to manufacture and results in a thinner, more compact detecting section, as it does not require curved reflective discs or flexed optical fibers. Additionally, the detector includes a power indicating optical fiber that does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry and can be run simultaneously with the optical fibers for detection, simplifying construction.

The present invention describes a process for continuously producing viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness through the completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying. The process simplifies the traditional method by reducing the number of treatments and improving the degree of whiteness without sacrificing quality or increasing costs. The washing water used in the process is obtained by treating industrial distribution network water with weakly acid ion exchange resins to achieve the desired pH and mineral content.

The text describes an invention for a small deaeration tank used in the pulp and paper industry to remove oxygen from pulp before washing. The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe. The swirl inducing fluid is the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach. The tank is preferably the same diameter as an oxygen reactor and has no moving parts. It can be placed on top of the reactor and operated at atmospheric pressure or under low pressure or vacuum. The tank is designed to maintain the consistency of pulp in the tank at a pumpable consistency using filtrate from the previous washer as the swirling fluid. The tank is cylindrical with an open top and a flat bottom, and its diameter and height are optimized for deaeration. The inlet pipe is located above the surface of the slurry and allows the pulp to splash against the side wall of the tank. The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a sensor and the flow is controlled by a valve. The filtrate swirler inlet is located near the bottom of the tank and provides a swirl to the slurry to enhance deaeration. The tank may be closed and used as a pressure or vacuum tank to recover oxygen or steam.

This text describes an invention related to composite materials, specifically biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. The invention uses a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which employs topology optimization to optimize material distribution and improve the given objective function. The BTR composite structure includes tendons, ribs, joints, flesh, skins, and shells. The two-dimensional material concept can be extended to a three-dimensional lattice structure. The use of embedded fiber tendons allows for neighboring tendons to act as safety members when a load-carrying tendon breaks. The invention can be applied to various panel shapes, including flat and curved panels, and can be embedded in a hardened matrix material. The stuffer members and tendon elements can be made of various materials and arranged in different ways, and the tendon elements can be tied or bonded at the points where they cross to form joints. The use of hollow stuffer members and bent-wire tendons simplifies manufacture and can be automated using pick-and-place robotics.

The text describes an invention related to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures, which can plastically deform during a dynamic event to dissipate energy and preserve the structure from extensive damage. The device is easily removable and replaceable with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device. The invention includes a braced frame structure, a load-limiting device attached to a brace, and a connection means to connect the load-limiting device to the brace and the braced frame structure. The load-limiting device may undergo plastic deformation when subjected to high lateral loads and may be removed and replaced after a dynamic event. The invention aims to provide a method for using a load-limiting device system in a braced frame to dissipate energy during dynamic events and maintain the structure's integrity.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use as a flophouse, with a flat exterior and the ability to accommodate shelves and electronic devices without reducing living space. The bedroom cabinet is made up of an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance formed between them for housing boxes and shelves. The upper and lower outer housings are formed with notches for the exit and are held together by resiliently held flanges and a clip member. The bedroom cabinet can be stacked or installed adjacent to each other due to its flat exterior surfaces. In the second embodiment, a clearance is provided between the outer casings and the inner casing over the entire periphery, with spacer members interposed to maintain the clearance and provide soundproofing and natural ventilation. The spacer members have varying strengths depending on their position.
</summary>

The present invention is a bedroom cabinet designed for use as a flophouse, with a flat exterior and the ability to accommodate shelves and electronic devices without reducing living space (Field and Background of the Invention). The bedroom cabinet is made up of an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance formed between them for housing boxes and shelves (Summary of the Invention). The upper and lower outer housings are formed with notches for the exit and are held together by resiliently held flanges and a clip member (Description of the Preferred Embodiments). The bedroom cabinet can be stacked or installed adjacent to each other due to its flat exterior surfaces (Summary of the Invention).

In the first embodiment, the upper and lower outer housings are integrally formed of a fiber reinforced plastic and have recesses with venting through-holes and horizontally outwardly projecting flanges (Description of the Preferred Embodiments). The inner casing is composed of six panels, including a front panel with an opening and boxes for an illuminating device and an interphone, and a back panel with boxes for various devices and a shelf (Description of the Preferred Embodiments). The front panel is formed with a notch for the upper half of the exit and is fitted into the upper outer housing, while the lower outer housing is fitted into the lower outer housing and the flanges are brought into abutment (Description of the Preferred Embodiments).

In the second embodiment, a clearance is

The text describes an invention for a portable and efficient guard rail support system for use in constructing temporary safety barriers at sites undergoing high rise apartment or office building construction. The system includes a base plate, upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The system can be used with wooden guard rails or a safety mesh, and can be anchored to the ground or floor using a concrete-filled steel base. The system meets safety regulations and can be easily assembled and disassembled by a single worker. The all-steel construction ensures durability and repeated use, reducing the need for constant replacement of materials. The system can be used in various situations where a temporary guard rail is required, such as around the perimeter of a roof or bridge construction.

The text describes a patent application related to a method and apparatus for enhancing oil production from oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic discharges. The invention aims to increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs by causing oil flow to be enhanced. The text discusses the background of the invention, which includes the challenge of enhancing oil recovery from secondary and tertiary Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) stages, and the limitations of current EOR methods. The text then discusses various prior art methods for EOR, including electrical methods, heating methods, and mechanical fracturing methods. The text also mentions the limitations of these methods and the need for a source that can provide stimulation at higher frequencies and greater distances from the stimulation source. The text then introduces the present invention, which uses a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for EOR. The pulsed power device uses capacitor banks to store electrical energy, which is then rapidly released through a spark gap or a single- or multiple-turn coil to generate a short-lived but extremely intense magnetic field. The text explains that the pulsed power discharge generates both a direct acoustic pulse and an electromagnetic pulse, which travel at different speeds through the reservoir and induce coupled acoustic vibrations at high frequencies in geologic materials. The text also discusses the importance of optimizing the energy absorption and effective stimulation by targeting the acoustic stimulation frequencies at specific inclusion scales in the reservoir. The text concludes by mentioning the improvements and differences of the present invention from the prior art.

The text describes a splice system for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures. The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip, and perforations for securing the plates together with a connective device. The longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip are interposed between the plates, preventing their removal.

The text describes a plow invention with a novel design for a blade that provides fluid passageways and points of fluid ejection, allowing efficient production using basic manufacturing processes. The blade consists of a blade, leading edge sections, point, and a fluid tube. The fluid tube transfers pressurized fluid from the top of the plow into the blade, and the location and length of the stitch welds between the blade and leading edge sections define the location and volume of fluid ejection. The fluid pressure and length of the tube, as well as the number and location of leading edge sections, can be adjusted to match specific job requirements. An alternate arrangement has the void or groove formed in the front of the blade instead of the back of the leading edge section. The invention provides a plow that can be tailored to specific applications using traditional manufacturing processes.

The present invention relates to a building system that allows for the creation of larger stucco panels without movement control joints, exceeding the standard height of 2.4 meters and width of 4 meters in New Zealand. The system involves a cavity wall plaster system with or without movement control joints, capable of providing walls of considerable size and non-square or non-rectangular perimeters. The panels can be up to 21 mm thick and can achieve dimensions of up to 12 meters wide and 4.85 meters high without mandatory movement control joints. The system caters to both NZS3604 and NZS4251 compliance, providing stucco walled structures with panel rigidity and integrity.

The text describes a new safe and door structure with a rectangular valuables chamber and a door having a plate-shaped, separate steel door with a rectangular cross-section that fits into the chamber with the help of inwardly extending ledges and grooves. The door has a lock assembly on the reverse side with a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar and reinforcing bolts on both sides to prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism during intrusion attempts. The structure can be made using a liner and concrete or all metal fabrication methods.

The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths by isolating the pressure sensing apparatus to pressures produced by the formation at that depth. This is accomplished by cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole at a desired location, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and creating a fluid connection between the formation and the filter. The cement grout is then removed from around the filter to form a communication path between the filter and the formation pressure. The cement grout isolates the pressure sensor in the borehole, allowing it to only be exposed to the fluid pressure in the formation adjacent to it. The methods described can be used for various reservoir types and involve the use of pressure transducers, check valves, filters, and cement grouting operations.

The text describes an invention related to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like, having an expansion function. The structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap. The joint block blocks up the expansion gap while permitting expansion gap function, preventing tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for smooth and safe vehicle traveling. The elastic members are made of laminated rubber and are easily joined together and subjected to deformation. The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, ensuring accurate level management and increasing slip resistance to tires. The components are detachably fitted for easy maintenance. The elastic members are designed to permit no deformation at the time when bridge girder length and drying shrinkage/creep effects have reached a median, ensuring free deformation or normal position whenever bridge girder length in ordinary temperatures has been reached. The expansion gap width can be set at a median between greatest and smallest expansion gap width to minimize expansion gap and avoid bridge girder ends contacting each other. The structure is adaptable for various tire configurations, ensures high slip resistance, permits less occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to maintain.

The present invention relates to a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber to transport wheeled trucks, such as hand trucks, without contaminating the sanitary environment. One embodiment includes a wheel channel with a cover plate and support legs, preventing showered fluid or floor liquid from entering the wheel channel and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels. The cover plate can be hinged for cleaning. Another embodiment accommodates trucks with downwardly depending struts, using inflatable elastomer seals to enclose the interior wheel channel and prevent brine solution entry. Both embodiments maintain the sanitary nature of the cooling fluid and enable its reuse. The invention enhances the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and achieving economic advantages. The enclosed floor track system segregates the hand truck wheel structure from the fluid treatment chamber environment, preventing contamination and enabling the brine solution to be recirculated without decontamination.

The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine's boom of a construction machine from being tilted by its own weight. The lock device includes an engaging member and an engaged member, with the engaging member having a hook part and a slot, and a support pin inserted into the slot with a guide member above it. The engaging member is provided with first and second surfaces, and either surface can touch the guide member when the engaged member is released or engaged, allowing for easy manual locking and unlocking.

The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head. The apparatus includes a platform with a central, cylindrical member for connecting to a flexible suction line, and outboard and inboard roller assemblies. The outboard roller assemblies have adjustable axles to regulate the spacing between the rollers and the pool bottom, while the inboard roller assemblies are connected to the platform on either side of the central opening. A frame member spans the platform and connects to the inboard roller assemblies, allowing for adjustment of the central, suction portion of the platform's height above the pool bottom to regulate suction efficiency. The roller height adjustment device, in kit form, can be added to certain types of existing suction head assemblies for precise regulation of suction without adjusting the suction source.

The present invention describes a wear bushing retriever apparatus that allows for the retrieval of a worn bushing from inside a casing head without the need to remove the drill bit. The apparatus consists of a sub-unit with a mandrel and a threadably removable collar, and a retriever section that is slidably engaged into the double grooved mandrel portion of the sub-unit. The retriever section has protruding members that engage with an extended J-slot of the wear bushing, and is prevented from rotating around the mandrel due to engagement with insertion members in the sub-unit's grooves. The apparatus can be easily installed and removed for quick wear bushing replacement during drilling operations.

<summary>
A vibratory tool for downhole use is described that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage, which can be closed by landing a plug on a seat. The dump valve is annularly disposed about the central passage to prevent it from being slammed against a seat during operation. The tool's functioning parts are housed in the tool body, making them stronger and more reliable. Modular stacked piston units increase the power delivered per stroke. The tool can be operated to deliver high amplitude low frequency oscillating forces to a stuck fish without impacts on the housing. The tool has a lower end attached to a stuck object, an upper end, a mandrel connected to the surface through a string, and lateral ports for pressure delivery. Pressure in the string pushes down on the pistons and mandrel, displacing fluid from the chamber and building pressure. The plug is retrievable, with a fishing neck for capture and return to the surface, and has a seal to help close off the passage. The dump valve is cylindrically shaped with a seal ring that moves between surfaces to close and open the valve. The tool's design allows for fewer moving parts, simpler plug design, and longer component life. The valve's cylindrical shape and seal ring eliminates significant cyclical impacts. The modular design allows for selection of the number of pistons and operation without piston impacts. The tool can be used for stimulation or fishing operations and provides large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a retaining wall system that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing and assembling parts at the site. The system consists of a precast concrete base and a face panel with an integral counterfort. The counterfort extends perpendicularly from the face panel and has an opening for drainage. Rebars are cast within the counterfort for added strength and act as tensioning devices.
