The base is a rectangular or trapezoidal platform that is set on grade and has openings to accept the downward-extending rebar ends from the counterfort. The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting the rebar into the openings and filling the voids with grout. The system is flexible in height and width, and all pieces can be made to custom sizes. The invention eliminates the need for temporary shoring during installation and reduces both installation and transportation costs. Additional features include the use of H-piles beneath the base for added stability and a vehicle impact barrier attached to the wall or rear side of the face panel.

The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for oil and gas wells to improve flow by effectively focusing heat on the production zone and protecting electrical components from down hole fluids. The system includes a heating unit with insulated heater rods, a heat insulating packer, and a stainless steel tubing collar. The electrical connections between the power leads and heater rods are shielded with a cement block and steel fitting assembly to prevent physical and chemical attack. The method involves using a down hole heating unit with shielded electrical connections and heat-retaining elements to focus heat on the production formation. The method can also be used with cable for supporting the heating unit while pipe is pulled from the well bore.

<summary>
The text describes an invention for a down hole tool mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, particularly for objects that may be stuck or lost. The invention improves upon existing mechanisms by promoting effective connection to down hole objects and simple disconnection if necessary. During drilling and servicing operations, objects can become stuck or lost in well bores and are referred to as "fish." Many types of pull tools and grappling devices have been developed for fishing operations. Down hole devices, such as those within casing and tubing strings, often have API Standard fishing necks with undercut shoulders for grappling. However, these necks can become worn or corroded, making connection difficult. The invention provides a mechanism for wire line controlled pulling tools to effectively connect and disconnect from worn fishing necks. The mechanism includes an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that moves telescopically within it. The inner and outer body structures selectively move into gripping relationship with the object to be removed, and the tool is locked or unlocked using a catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position. The pin structure of the catch mechanism alternately enters unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another. The tool can be locked or unlocked simply by downward or upward movement of the control line tool.
</summary>

The text describes an invention for a down hole tool mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, particularly for objects that may be stuck or lost. The invention improves upon existing mechanisms by promoting effective connection to down hole objects and simple disconnection if necessary. The invention is related to U.S. Pat. No. 4,061,389 and specifically addresses the issue of connecting and disconnecting wire line controlled fishing tools to worn fishing necks. During drilling and servicing operations, objects can become stuck or lost in well bores and are referred to as "fish." Many types of pull tools and grappling devices have been developed for fishing operations. Down hole devices, such as those within casing and tubing strings, often have API Standard fishing necks with undercut shoulders for grappling. However, these necks can become worn or corroded, making connection difficult.

The invention provides a mechanism for wire line controlled pulling tools to effectively connect and disconnect from worn fishing necks. The mechanism includes an outer

<summary>
The present application claims priority to three Mexican patent applications and incorporates their entire contents. The text discusses the drawbacks of conventional composed stave floors, including their thin sight substrate, which can warp or detach during sanding or maintenance, and the use of glue for bonding the base and sight substrates, which can result in displacement or changes in dimensions. The invention is a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a thicker sight substrate (at least 4 mm) and a base substrate (at least 12 mm), which are assembled using glue and multidirectional holding means. The holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane. The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate, prevent deformation and detachment, and allow for corrective maintenance. The preferred glazes for the floors include aluminum oxide or other hard metals. The text includes figures to illustrate the conventional and invented floors.
</summary>

Example of a Conventional Composed Stave Floor:
A conventional composed stave floor was manufactured with a base substrate and a sight substrate for the traffic surface. After a short period of time, the floor exhibited detachment. When the glue was applied to the sight substrate for maintenance, it resulted in a noticeable frizziness.

Example of a Composed Stave Floor of the Invention:
A composed stave floor was manufactured with a base substrate having a thickness of 15 mm and a sight substrate with a thickness of 6 mm. The substrates were assembled using glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means. The floor did not deform or detach and could be maintained, resulting in increased durability.

The invention aims to address the issues of thin sight substrates and glue bonding in conventional composed stave floors by using a thicker sight substrate and multidirectional holding means. The holding means provide additional support and prevent displacement or changes in dimensions. The preferred glazes for the floors offer increased hardness without affecting their appearance. The invention allows for longer floor life and the ability

The text describes an invention for a ladder attachment that addresses the issues of lateral stability and contact area with the work surface. The attachment includes a brace with a flange and U-bolt, and a resilient pad assembly. The flange attaches to the ladder rung, and the U-bolt secures the brace to the ladder siderail. A clamp holds the brace in place, and a resilient pad protects the work surface from damage. The design allows the ladder to straddle corners without losing stability.

The text describes a fastener assembly for use in a fastener driving tool, consisting of a row of fasteners arranged parallel to each other and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners. The plastic material defines a collar portion that captures or encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin or a polyolefin blend, and is preheated before molding to enhance adhesion to the nails. The strip can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the connecting portions at a desired location, reducing debris and impact on the connecting portion during driving. The collation system includes upper and lower plastic moldings adhered to the fasteners, with the lower molding formed nearer to the tip of the fastener and having a taper to facilitate penetration into the substrate. The method for making the fastener assembly includes arranging a plurality of fasteners in a row, preheating them, molding plastic material onto the preheated fasteners and between adjacent fasteners, and cooling the strip to form the fastener assembly. The assembly can also be configured with a rib that extends less than the axial length of the collar portion and has a width greater than the width of the collar. The connecting portion can include a bridge that is integral with the rib and extends substantially the axial length of the collar portion, such that the rib and bridge have a substantially cruciform shape. The rib can be tapered, narrowing toward the tip of the fastener, and the bridge can be tapered, narrowing toward the tip of the fastener. The assembly can include upper and lower collations parallel to and spaced from one another, with the lower collation narrower than the upper collation. The collation system reduces debris, corrugation, and the tendency for the plastic to separate from the nail shank during driving.

The text describes an invention related to a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly silicones, in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle comprises a bell or hood shaped tip and an injection button, allowing for precise sealing operations and encapsulation of rivets or nuts. The bell-shaped section and injection button are connected in a non-perermanent manner, allowing for easy removal and replacement. The nozzle can be used with most sealant cartridges or injection machines and is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene. The text also describes a second embodiment with lateral outlets in the injection button. The nozzle provides advantages such as versatility, precision, and ease of use, and can be used for both manual and automated applications. The invention represents a significant improvement over current nozzles in the market, which are often made of metal, hazardous to clean, and lack precision in sealing operations.

The text describes a position sensor system that uses a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and eliminate unwanted power, allowing for multiplexing of multiple sensors using only two wires. The error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals that do not provide position information, and uses a window reference circuit to adjust the sensor output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.

The text describes an invention related to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, which eliminates the need for springs and offers variable valve displacement for efficient and effective control of valve port openness. The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which converts the reciprocating linear motion into a substantially infinitely variable reciprocating motion for the valve. The valve's position is controlled by an adjustable member that moves normal to the line of action and is actuated by an electromechanical or hydraulic actuator. The cam groove curvatures are designed for optimal engine performance, and the system can be computer-controlled for precise and timely valve control.

The text describes a lighting system for aquariums using LEDs, including a light member with a housing and a lighting control region on the bottom side that includes channels for controlling different colors of light and a switch for controlling the channels. The light member also includes one or more light-emitting modules that can be coupled to the lighting control region and emit the controlled colors of light. The system allows for adjustable color temperature output and variable functionality in a compact design.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, specifically addressing the issues of complex casting, high blade weight, and difficult cooling in prior art rotor blades for gas turbines. The invention involves constructing separating walls, which bound cooling channels, as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted and secured into the apparatus, rather than casting them together. This approach eliminates the disadvantages of large material amounts, thermal stresses, and complex casting processes. A preferred embodiment includes a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for the separating walls, simplifying assembly and ensuring a good seal. The separating walls can be flat strips of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials. Another preferred embodiment includes connecting the inserted separating walls to the flow deflection apparatus by an integral material joint for added security. The cooling fluid can flow in mutually opposite directions in adjacent cooling channels, with deflection produced by a U-shaped separating wall. The invention results in significant simplifications for blades in gas turbines and high-speed rotor blades.
</summary>

The present invention describes a system for controlling the fuel delivery system of a vehicle, which can be switched between automatic and manual control. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and provides a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor to set the throttle position. During manual control, the vehicle driver has full control of the vehicle by directly operating the throttle valve through the accelerator pedal. The system can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission and can be programmed to switch to the optimum control mode for the throttle based on the transmission ratio.

<summary>
This text describes an invention for a waste fuel burner that aims to minimize particulate emissions and operate efficiently. The burner uses a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through it, drying and gasifying the fuel. Swirl air is introduced tangentially in a primary combustion chamber to maintain a steady temperature and separate particulate matter. The volatile gases are then partially oxidized in a secondary combustion chamber with secondary air for complete combustion. The flame holder in the secondary chamber prevents particulate matter from entering and forces it back into the primary chamber. The burner can handle fuels with high moisture content and is self-regulating with fast response times. The primary and secondary chambers can be added to any source of dirty, particulate-laden combustible gas. The flame holder also serves as a barrier against secondary chamber air entering the primary chamber. The pressure isolator, a thin-walled circular cylinder with radial vanes, further isolates the primary chamber from secondary chamber air. The amount of swirl air is adjusted based on the primary chamber exit temperature. The burner can be used in various industrial applications, including boilers and kilns, and can be controlled manually or automatically.
</summary>

The text describes an invention for a waste fuel burner that minimizes particulate emissions and operates efficiently. The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through it, drying and gasifying the fuel. Swirl air is introduced tangentially in a primary combustion chamber to maintain a steady temperature and separate particulate matter. The volatile gases are then partially oxidized in a secondary combustion chamber with secondary air for complete combustion. The flame holder in the secondary chamber prevents particulate matter from entering and forces it back into the primary chamber. The burner can handle fuels with high moisture content and is self-regulating with fast response times. The primary and secondary chambers can be added to any source of dirty, particulate-laden combustible gas. The flame holder also serves as a barrier against secondary chamber air entering the primary chamber. The pressure isolator, a thin-walled circular cylinder with radial vanes, further isolates the primary chamber from secondary chamber air. The amount of swirl air is adjusted based on the primary chamber exit temperature. The burner

The text describes an efficient evaporative refrigeration system that keeps evaporating water separate from the cooling air stream through a heat exchanger, achieving sensible cooling. The system uses a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled and a major portion of fresh air for the dry side of the heat exchanger. The heat exchanger consists of an array of spaced vertically directed hollow tubular members with water flowing downwardly along the inner surfaces and fresh air flowing externally for cooling. The moisture-laden return air is exhausted and can be heat-exchanged with fresh air before being discharged. The system allows for variations in operation, such as recirculating return air with fresh air or diverting cooled air to mix with the working return air. The text also discusses a hybrid system that combines an evaporative cooler with a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool a minor portion of the air and dehumidify it. This results in a more effective heat exchanger and a lower dry bulb temperature for the incoming useful air. The condenser coil of the vapor compression refrigeration unit is also disposed in the discharge path of the wet side of the heat exchanger for energy savings.

<summary>
The text describes a fluid pump with two or more pump heads arranged in series, where fluid flows from a reservoir into one pump head and then to the next pump head in the series, to be eventually discharged from an outlet in a final pump head. Each pump head comprises a housing within which an impeller is contained, the impeller being driven by a drive structure to move fluid. The housing of the pump head comprises an inlet through which fluid is drawn from outside the housing, and the fluid is moved by the impeller from the housing into at least two fluid conduits, preferably at least three fluid conduits, to be combined into one fluid flow before exiting the pump head. One or more of the pump heads may comprise a combiner for combining fluid flow from the at least two fluid conduits into a single fluid flow. The combiner may comprise a fluid chamber in which fluid flow from the at least two conduits are combined into the single flow. The fluid chamber of the combiner may comprise openings to permit entry of the fluid from the conduits, and another opening to permit a single outward flow of the fluid from the pump head. The single flow of fluid from one pump head into another defines a fluid flow path between the pump heads. The drive structure may comprise any one or collection of structures that is configured to impart rotational motion on the impellers. The drive structure is preferably powered by a single power source, such as a motor. The motor may be an electric motor, hydraulic motor, combustion motor, or any other motor that can be configured to drive the drive structure. The drive shafts within a pump head may extend out from the pump head in one or more directions or may be wholly contained within the pump head. The fluid pump comprises at least two pump heads, for example two, three, or four pump heads, and the pump heads are disposed in series so that fluid flows sequentially through each pump head of the pump, each pump head being in fluid communication with the pump head before and after in the series. The initial and final pump heads are in direct fluid communication with only one other pump head, the initial pump head drawing fluid from a reservoir in through an inlet in the housing of the initial pump head, and the final pump head expelling fluid out through an outlet of the final pump head. Pump heads may be connected to provide rigidity

<summary>
This text describes an engine compression release brake system for engines with fewer components than traditional systems, which typically include an engine brake for each engine cylinder. The present invention includes an engine with a modular engine compression release brake system for a portion of the engine cylinders, rather than all of them. The system includes a hydraulically actuated engine compression release brake for each cylinder with the brake being operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve. The engine includes a high pressure pump, a hydraulic system, and an electronic control module that controls multiple aspects of engine operation, including engine compression release brake timing. Each cylinder has a movable piston and is operably connected to hydraulically and/or mechanically actuated devices, including a fuel injector and a cam actuated exhaust valve. A portion of cylinders each include a hydraulically actuated engine compression release brake that is operably connected to the exhaust valve for the cylinder. The engine brake has a brake body, an electrical actuator, and a spool valve member that is movable between an upward, retracted position and a downward, advanced position. When the engine brake is activated, high pressure fluid flows into the actuation fluid passage, moving the piston and opening the exhaust valve for engine braking. The engine brake system reduces the number of engine components, improving overall robustness.
</summary>

The text describes an invention related to a link assembly between an engine and a gearbox, which includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain them. The female link receives the male link to allow translation and form a radial interface that dampens the translation. The pin can shear under extreme loads, allowing the links to translate and preventing damage to the gearbox and engine. The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy from the translation.

The present invention introduces a point cap system with an adjustable balance pin for attaching arrow points to lightweight graphite arrow shafts, reducing stress on the shaft and preventing dirt entry. The system includes a small, lightweight point cap with external threads and a balance pin that can be trimmed to adjust weight for perfect arrow balance. The invention also provides means to attach points and nocks to arrow shafts without allowing dirt entry and utilizes the strength of unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts.

<summary>
The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for military training, which utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system. The invention produces realistic small arms fire noise and flash by igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port. The electrical control circuit provides automatic and semiautomatic fire and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt. The bolt interface engages the weapon's bolt to simulate operator actions, while the trigger interface debounces the trigger signal and sends it to the oscillator control circuit. The oscillator control circuit clocks the 500 Hertz and 10 Hertz oscillators based on the weapon's bolt actuation and trigger squeeze, respectively. The firing counter accumulates the timing pulses from the oscillators and decoder decodes the count to trigger the firing control, which uses SCRs to ignite the pyrotechnic charges. The firing sensor detects the voltage drop across diodes when a charge fires and resets the oscillator control circuit to stop the firing. The small arms firing effect simulator is packaged to resemble an M16 magazine clip and is designed for automatic fabrication to reduce cost.
</summary>

The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves performance and reduces noise. It includes a tank, two pipes with different cross-sectional areas, and a control valve. The tank is connected to the intake pipe by two pipes, one with a larger cross-sectional area and one with a smaller cross-sectional area. The smaller pipe opens to the intake passage closer to the air cleaner than the larger pipe. A control valve is disposed in the larger pipe and actuated by a vacuum diaphragm actuator. The valve opens when a vacuum is introduced into the vacuum chamber, which is created by the actuator. The vacuum is supplied from a vacuum tank through a solenoid valve, controlled by a controller based on engine load conditions. The smaller pipe acts as a resonator to absorb intake noise, reducing it to permissible levels. The valve is opened or closed at specific engine speeds to create a new compound curve of volumetric efficiency, improving engine performance. The length of the air inlet pipe upstream of the air cleaner is decreased to improve performance but increases noise, so the present invention aims to decrease noise while maintaining performance. The resonator effect is determined by the relationship between the frequency of the intake noise, the speed of sound, the cross-sectional area of the passage in the pipe, the length of the passage, and the volume of the tank. The valve is preferably closed at low engine loads and opened at high loads and speeds above a certain threshold. These operating conditions can be stored as a map in the control circuit and activated based on engine speed and throttle position sensor inputs.

The text describes an invention of a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment onto various surfaces, including poles, walls, and columns. The system consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket. The adjustable bracket is attached to the object to be mounted and then positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object on the surface. The adjustable bracket can be easily rotated into a locked position and temporarily snapped into place using integrated hooks and tabs. The assembly is suitable for outdoor use and can be adjusted for directional positioning with separate pole adapters. The system is designed for one person installation and uses minimal components, providing economic and time-based efficiency. The assembly includes a pole clamp system for mounting to poles and can be used for various objects such as speakers, lighting, signage, and monitors.

<summary>
The text describes a burner system for various heat utilizing appliances, including a burner design with a combustion chamber, an outer shroud, and a fuel holder. The burner design includes a perforate food grate, an ash pan, and a cover. The burner has legs for support and is pivotally coupled to a modular heat utilizing appliance through manual couplings. The system includes a closed cooker, an open cooker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer as examples of modular heat utilizing appliances. The pyrolyzer includes a pyrolysis chamber, a condenser, and a heat exchanger. The burner system aims to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions.
</summary>

The text discusses the need for an efficient, clean burning burner for use with diverse heat utilizing appliances. The burner design includes a combustion chamber, an outer wall, and a fuel holder. Air flows through the fuel holder for initial combustion and around it for secondary combustion, while a shroud provides a flow path for tertiary combustion air. The burner has legs, a pivotally coupled ash pan, and a perforate food grate with a cover. The burner can be removably coupled to various modular heat utilizing appliances, including cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The pyrolyzer includes a pyrolysis chamber, a condenser, and a heat exchanger. The burner system aims to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions.

The text introduces a burner system for heat utilizing appliances, which includes a burner with a combustion chamber, an outer wall, and a fuel holder. The burner design features a perforate food grate, an ash pan, and a cover. The burner has legs and is pivotally coupled to a modular heat utilizing appliance through manual couplings. The system includes a closed cooker, an open cooker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer as examples of modular heat utilizing appliances. The pyrolyzer includes a pyrolysis chamber, a condenser, and a heat exchanger. The burner system aims to optimize efficiency and limit un

This text describes a problem with the cooling system of rotary internal combustion engines, specifically in the area surrounding spark plug bosses. The in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water passageway creates a flow shadow effect, preventing a controlled flow regime and leading to boiling at the plugs and vapor buildup. The invention aims to address this issue by staggering the spark plug bosses with respect to the flow direction, allowing for improved coolant distribution and vapor release during boiling heat transfer. The staggered arrangement promotes relatively close in-line arrangement of the spark plug terminals while maintaining a predetermined offset to prevent detrimental effects on combustion propagation. The use of flow diverters or controllers between the bosses ensures a controlled flow regime and strengthens the housing structure. The invention results in a significant increase in the heat transfer coefficient of the cooling circuit at the spark plug boss zone.

The present invention is a method of minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing by using control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance. The method calculates total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position and determines the difference in flow characteristics between N and N-1 turbine flow control valves. A "smoothing out" curve is obtained to control flow change of the remaining open valves when one is closed and reopened. The test compensation circuit uses this information to compensate for flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing. The invention was tested and resulted in a 95% reduction in pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure.

The text describes an adjustable mixing valve for a cleaning apparatus that allows users to control the strength of their cleaning solution by continuously adjusting the ratio of soap solution to water. The valve system reduces the flow rate of each fluid to maintain constant pressure at the inlet passages, enabling multiple users to operate identical valves from a common soap solution and water source.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure. The compressor station includes a compressor, heat exchanger, pipelines, valves, and control units. An electronic control system operates the compressor to compress gas to excess pressure and expands it to the desired exit pressure. The invention utilizes the physical effect of gas expansion to cool it, reducing the need for separate cooling units during warmer months. The compression to excess pressure can be carried out in multiple stages, with the excess pressure selected to allow for sufficient cooling during expansion. The expansion can be achieved through a valve or an expansion turbine, with the latter recovering mechanical energy for use in compressing the gas. The compressors in the primary compression stages can be exchanged, allowing for flexibility in handling changes in pipeline pressure and cooling requirements throughout the year. The compressor station can be controlled by an electronic system.
</summary>

The text describes a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing gas to a higher pressure than the desired exit pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and obtaining further cooling by expanding the gas to the desired exit pressure. The compressor station includes a compressor, heat exchanger, pipelines, valves, and control units. An electronic control system operates the compressor to compress gas to an excess pressure and expands it to the desired exit pressure. The invention utilizes the known physical effect of gas expansion to cool it, reducing the need for separate cooling units during warmer months. The compression to excess pressure can be carried out in multiple stages, with the excess pressure selected to allow for sufficient cooling during expansion. The expansion can be achieved through a valve or an expansion turbine, with the latter recovering mechanical energy for use in compressing the gas. The compressors in the primary compression stages can be exchanged, allowing for flexibility in handling changes in pipeline pressure and cooling requirements throughout the year. The compressor station can be controlled by an electronic system.

The text explains that natural gas is transported in large quantities over long distances in gas pipelines, and compressor stations are necessary to maintain the required pressure. In permanent fro

The text describes an invention for mounting cooling fans to a panel without using fasteners. The cooling fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and mounting legs with resilient portions that fit into recesses in the panel. The mounting legs have spring members that urge the fan carrier away from the panel, preventing it from becoming disengaged during operation. The fan is installed by pushing it against the panel until the springs compress, then rotating it to capture the legs in smaller openings. The springs remain compressed, urging the fan against the panel and reducing vibrational noise and the risk of legs backing out.

The text discusses the challenges of reducing vibration levels in spacecraft structures, particularly for precision instruments mounted on kinematic mounts (KMs) which have limited inherent damping. The invention aims to provide novel kinematic mounts with damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. Two preferred embodiments of dampers are presented: a spherical damper using viscoelastic material and a cylindrical slot damper using o-rings. Both dampers are designed to be effective at high frequencies during launch and negligible at low frequencies on-orbit. The dampers can be integrated into existing KM structures, and the invention also proposes a simple design using six identical struts and a center-of-gravity mounting system to approximately uncouple the mount suspension modes. The proposed mounting concept offers significant benefits, including improved damping and simplified design.

The text describes a novel and improved oil shear clutch unit for large power transmission requirements, which utilizes separate piston and cylinder means for each set of clutch disc segments and clutch plates, hydraulic fluid for retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant, and interleaved clutch plates and clutch discs with arcuate segments that can be separately removed without disturbing the other segments. The clutch unit is used in a stored energy rotary drive aircraft catapult system and is controlled by a servo control valve and fluid amplifiers.

The text describes an engine system that utilizes expansion cylinders downstream of combustion cylinders to expand exhaust gas and water, reducing the temperature of the fluids and potentially eliminating the need for a radiator. The system also incorporates catalytic materials on surfaces exposed to hot exhaust gases for catalytic conversion of impurities and water recovery for reuse. Gearing is used between the expansion and combustion cylinders to optimize output and reduce one-to-one driving of the crankshaft.

The text describes a method for fabricating plates or blanks of coated steel intended for welding and heat treatment to produce parts with good mechanical strength, high impact resistance, and corrosion resistance, commonly used in the automotive industry. The method involves starting with a steel plate coated with aluminum or aluminum alloy, which undergoes heat treatment to form a surface alloy and is then hot-pressed and quenched to create quenched parts with varying thicknesses and mechanical characteristics. However, this method faces difficulties due to the formation of intermetallic areas within the welded joints, which reduce the overall deformability and can lead to rupture. To address this issue, the invention proposes a plate with a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer in contact with the substrate, topped by a metal alloy layer. The metal alloy layer is removed on one face of the plate in an area at the periphery, which is then butt-welded with another plate to create a blank. The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is adjusted to ensure no intermetallic areas are formed during welding and to maintain satisfactory corrosion resistance. The invention also provides a method for fabricating the precoated steel plate by removing the metal alloy layer in an area not totally contiguous with the periphery and cutting the plate to create a plate with the removal area at the periphery. The method can be monitored by measuring the emissivity or reflectivity of the area over which the metal alloy layer is removed and stopping the removal operation when the difference from the reference value is above a critical value. The invention provides a plate, blank, or part with a specific steel composition and microstructure, and the method can be integrated into existing welding lines and is compatible with subsequent pressing or heat treatment phases. The fabricated parts have satisfactory ductility and good corrosion resistance, with a total elongation across the welded joint greater than or equal to 4%.

The present application is a continuation of a previous patent application related to a SCADA system for optimally navigating and operating a mobile energy recovery system in severe weather conditions. The system uses data from GPS, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites to navigate a sailing vessel, optimizing energy efficiency and yield through performance models and weather data analysis. The system includes a control and communications microprocessor system on the mobile structure and a server at a central service facility, with secure server and client software applications communicating via a LAN or WAN. The control system includes motor and gear systems for actuating rudder, propeller, or sail trim, and a Graphical User Interface at the central service facility allows human operators to interact with the system and alter control settings. The system also includes a least-cost and highest yield path analysis for navigating through weather patterns and avoiding physical objects. SCADA object tags allow for structured programming and access to various data structures and control functions. The system is not limited to sailing vessels or specific weather patterns and can be applied to any mobile structure extracting energy from natural sources.

The text describes an invention related to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element made of sheet metal, which is formed by forming techniques and consists of several rolling body guide structures arranged in the circumferential direction. The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in the circumferential direction and connected via joints in a production step preceding the formation of the axial profiling. The flat material ring segments are welded together along their edge regions facing one another within the joints, forming engagement zones where they are connected via positively engaging joint contours. The invention reduces production costs by minimizing cutting waste and is particularly advantageous for rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of over 140 mm. The method for manufacturing the rolling body guide cage involves producing the ring element from sheet metal, forming it into the desired shape, and joining the flat material ring segments together via welding before the axial profiling step.

<summary>
The text describes methods and systems for obtaining and processing information related to customer service locations in telecommunications networks. The systems include a technician input device for receiving and transmitting information, a technician server for processing and verifying data, and a global positioning satellite system for acquiring coordinates. The methods involve requesting and obtaining coordinates from a customer service location, updating databases with the coordinates, and generating directions for travel between service locations. The systems can also include a mapping system for generating travel directions and a dispatch system for managing service requests and technician schedules. The use of latitude and longitude coordinates improves the efficiency and accuracy of customer service by allowing technicians to locate customer service locations more easily.
</summary>

1. The text discusses methods and systems for acquiring and processing information related to customer service locations in telecommunications networks.
2. The systems include a technician input device, a technician server, and a global positioning satellite system.
3. The technician input device is used by a service technician to access and transmit information related to a customer service location.
4. The technician server processes and verifies data transmitted from the input device and interacts with other systems, such as a global positioning satellite system and a dispatch system.
5. The global positioning satellite system is used to acquire coordinates associated with a customer service location.
6. The methods involve requesting and obtaining coordinates from a customer service location, updating databases with the coordinates, and generating directions for travel between service locations.
7. The systems can also include a mapping system for generating travel directions and a dispatch system for managing service requests and technician schedules.
8. The use of latitude and longitude coordinates improves the efficiency and accuracy of customer service by allowing technicians to locate customer service locations more easily.
9. The technician server interacts with other systems, such as the global positioning satellite system, to obtain coordinates and update databases.
10. The methods and systems can reduce response time and improve customer service by providing accurate and specific information about customer service locations.

The text describes a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit. The control unit receives the output signals of the two real sensors, combines them to form three output signals of a virtual sensor, and uses these signals as inputs for independent control loops operating in parallel. The control loops have control algorithms that transform the virtual input signals into changed signals, which are then used to calculate control signals for the six coils. The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields and can be used to simulate measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected. The control system can be designed as a digital signal processor or a field programmable gate array. The system can also be used to equalize potentially arising feedback effects when using two magnetic field compensation systems in immediate vicinity. The text also discusses the challenges of controlling magnetic field compensation systems, including the difficulty of optimizing control systems for different applications and the limitations of non-linear control systems.

The present application is the US national phase of an international application that claims priority to a German application, and relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy. In this method, at least one resonance site is furnished by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner. Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes and are particularly advantageous for use in CARS microscopy. The invention allows the creation of resonance sites in samples that do not inherently possess them, enabling selective detection and imaging of specific molecules without negatively affecting biochemical processes. The use of bioorthogonal reactions also allows for a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in CARS microscopy, improving the reproducibility and quantitative conclusions of the method. The invention can be used in combination with various types of bioorthogonal reactions, such as copper-free click reactions, nitrone dipolar cycloadditions, norbornene cycloadditions, (4+1) cycloadditions, and oxanorbornadiene cycloadditions. The method can be used in a CARS microscope, which includes a laser for generating a light beam, a selection means for selecting pump and Stokes light beams, and a detector for detecting the resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering. The sample is introduced into the investigation system, and the obtained signal is sensed and used to derive structural properties of the chemical structures containing the resonance sites.

The text describes a system for assessing segmentations of patient structures for radiation therapy using electronic files, which are converted into volume models and compared to identify missing and extra volume elements. The system uses a metric method to evaluate the conformance between the segmentations and produces an output indicating the quality of the segmentation with respect to the reference. The system can be used for training, evaluation, and product evaluation purposes.

The text describes an invention related to data processing systems and the execution of floating point operations. Floating point operations, which involve adding and subtracting numbers represented in the floating point format, are more complex and time-consuming than standard data format operations due to the need to align fractions and normalize results. The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments before the complete difference is available, and using this subset difference to initiate subtraction of operand fractions or fractional portions thereof. The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions, which is already available. This reduces the number of steps required to execute the effective subtraction operation, resulting in faster processing. The apparatus for implementing this technique includes units for determining the difference between the subset of operand exponent arguments and the operand fractions, as well as logic for selecting the appropriate procedure based on the subset difference.

The text describes a method and system for tracking specimens acquired from patients using unique machine-readable codes on ID bands, orders, specimen containers, and ID means worn by patients and specimen-takers. The method involves storing patient and order information in a computer database with their respective barcodes, verifying the patient's ID band and order barcode match, and applying preapplied vial barcodes to specimen containers before storing them in the database. The system includes a standalone or networked computer, computer storage, and an electronic reading means for scanning barcodes. The method aims to reduce mislabeling of specimen vials and improve patient safety. Each machine-readable code is unique and can be a barcode. The ID means worn by patients can be a bracelet, and the ID means worn by specimen-takers can be a badge. The first machine-readable code can encode patient information, and the fourth machine-readable code can encode specimen container information. The second machine-readable code can encode order information. The electronic reading means can be a barcode scanner.

The text describes an invention of a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers that uses both GPS and voice recognition technology. The device can be incorporated into articles of clothing or headgear, such as a golf hat or visor. It provides distance and other golf course information verbally to the user via a loudspeaker or headphone. The device may also memorize and compute user data to predict golf strategy and club selection based on past performance. The bone conductance vibration sensor used in the device picks up the user's voice clearly while rejecting external noise, increasing voice recognition accuracy. The device may be used for various applications, including hiking, surveying, and scuba diving. It may also be connected to a separate computer for detailed functions such as score tracking and expert system advice. The device uses Bluetooth technology for data transfers, audio communications, and remote GPS functionality. Users can record golf course coordinates using a portable computing device and share recorded courses with others.

The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method for accurately reporting errors in logic and memory regions of a system-on-chip integrated circuit design. Customized design rules are created based on modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of particular memory regions. These customized rules are used to check different areas of an IC layout, resulting in separate error reports for logic, memory, and other regions. The system can be applied to any mask pattern database and eliminates the need for manual checking and false errors. The invention distinguishes between logic and memory polygons within a layer, ensuring that appropriate design rules are applied to each region. This results in a more reliable, efficient, and accurate design rule checking process.

This text describes an invention that uses thin substrate waveguides as improved illuminators for objects, particularly holograms and spatial light modulators, by optically coupling them to a coherent light source. The illumination system provides high diffraction efficiencies and eliminates stray light, occupying less space compared to conventional lens systems. However, it requires careful alignment and design, and non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction must be addressed.

The text describes an invention for non-destructively testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, to determine their resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew. The invention is important because manufacturing defects in these rotors can affect their performance and quality. Prior art methods for testing rotors include using the stator core, destructive testing, or non-destructive techniques with limitations. The invention provides a method and apparatus for economical and reliable testing, with automatic pass/fail determinations and statistical comparison of results. The test apparatus includes a test head with a magnetic core, primary windings, voltage pick-up coils, skew pick-up coils, and a current sensor. The test head rotates the rotor and measures the induced voltages and currents to calculate power, resistance, reactance, and effective skew values. The data is processed and compared to predetermined threshold values to determine if the rotor is good or defective. Additional statistical information is stored for analysis over numerous tests. The test fixture structure includes a spindle, a clutch mechanism, and a hydraulic cylinder for retracting and rotating the rotor. The rotor is held in place by the clutch mechanism when in the retracted position. The invention is described in detail with diagrams and flowcharts.

The text describes a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources of the operating system only to managed libraries with valid digital certificates, while denying access to managed applications that do not have the necessary authorization. The method involves a manager that receives requests from managed applications to access native resources through managed libraries, authorizes the request if the managed library is authorized to access the resource and has a valid digital certificate, and sends a request to the runtime host to access the native resource. The runtime host then accesses the native resource on behalf of the managed library. The text also discusses alternative techniques such as platform invokes, validating digital signatures of the runtime host and manager, and sharing managed applications with other devices. The method aims to provide more control for the provider over how third-party code is treated on the device.

<summary>
This text describes an improved identification card invention that includes an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip sandwiched between two protective, non-rigid layers, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers. The card uses a core layer made of a silica-filled polyolefin, an alkyd resin spid with an anti-binding agent, and a bottom sheet also made of a silica-filled polyolefin. The core layer and bottom sheet are bonded together using an adhesive layer and an additional adhesive layer is used to attach the integrated circuit chip to the bottom layer. Two transparent polymer layers are then laminated to the bonded core layer/bottom layer structure to provide mechanical strength and protect the image-receiving layer. The image-receiving layer can be formed using a dye diffusion thermal transfer process or inkjet printing. The card can have one or two image-receiving layers, each with second indicia for human and machine reading, and a protective layer to prevent damage and bleeding of dye.
</summary>

The text describes an invention for implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure. The tree structure is balanced, with all leaf nodes at the same level and all nodes full except for those on the edges. Nodes are filled upwards, with a non-full leaf node on the edge being filled first. The invention reduces the amount of required copying compared to a typical double-ended list implementation. A preferred embodiment adds a header node with three elements: one for the end of the queue, one for the middle part, and one for the beginning of the queue. The header node allows for faster and less space-consuming updates. Another preferred embodiment adds a bit to the header node indicating which edge of the header node is the end and which is the beginning, allowing for constant time and space inversion of the queue. The invention can be used for both FIFO and LIFO (double-ended) queues. The text also mentions a block diagram of a memory arrangement implementing the invention.

The text describes an invention that allows for the manufacture of electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies, specifically for use in DRAM redundancy circuits and standard logic technologies. The invention utilizes DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors for EPROM devices, allowing for higher gate coupling ratios and reduced operation voltages. The EPROM devices can be manufactured using the same procedures as DRAM, reducing manufacturing costs. The invention also introduces stress effect programmable read-only memory (SEPROM) devices, which use the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data. SEPROM devices have the advantage of being able to be manufactured using any IC technology and are ideal for embedded applications, but have the disadvantage of longer write times and limited re-programmability.

The text describes an invention for determining the optimum values of feedback gains in a feedback control system. The method involves executing feedback control using initially set gains, detecting errors, calculating evaluation values based on the errors, and repeating the process with new gain values until suitable evaluation values are obtained. The evaluation values are used to determine the optimum values of proportional (P), integral (I), and differential (D) gains. The method allows for accurate and efficient determination of feedback gains, irrespective of the kind of controlled system. The text also discusses two embodiments of the method, one using a limit sensitivity process and another using continuous running of the controlled system along the course. The second embodiment determines the gains while the system makes an excursion of the course, using trigger signals to mark the boundary points between adjacent course sections.

The text describes an invention of a zoom lens that achieves a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end with a reduced size while maintaining high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range. The lens consists of a first lens unit for focusing, a second lens unit for magnification variation, a third lens unit for compensating for image plane shift, a fourth lens unit for making the diverging light beam almost afocal, and a fifth lens unit for image formation. The fourth and fifth lens units are designed to correct residual aberrations such as spherical aberration and coma. The invention satisfies specific conditions related to the refractive power, radius of curvature, Abbe number, and air separation of the lenses to achieve good correction of aberrations and balance longitudinal and lateral chromatic aberrations. Additionally, the invention prefers a refractive power ratio for the second lens unit to be within a certain range to minimize the variation of aberrations with zooming and reduce the physical length of the entire lens system.

The text describes a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, or photons, by generating a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through it and converting each charge pulse into an electric signal for amplification and indication or recording. The invention enables both the detection of individual particles and the integration of their signals, regardless of the signal rates, without requiring prior knowledge of the expected count or signal rates. This is achieved by discharging the detector on the low-voltage side, which simplifies the detection of small-size signals and prevents interference from a leakage current in high-voltage cables. The invention also proposes the use of a converter material for detecting uncharged particles and a fast charge transport material, such as diamond, for detecting particles over wide signal or count rates.

This text describes an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly in friction clutches. The apparatus includes a stationary and movable ring, a torque motor, and a servo motor. The driven disc assembly is mounted between the rings and is frictionally engaged when the movable ring is moved towards the stationary ring. The torque motor is used to apply a predetermined torque to the driven disc assembly, while the servo motor moves the movable ring to gradually reduce the frictional force. When the driven disc assembly begins to rotate under the urging of the torque motor, the distance separating the rings is measured to determine if the disc assembly is excessively warped. The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly passes or fails the test. The control system includes a microprocessor, optical encoder, position sensor, and servo motor sensors. The microprocessor reads the signals from the sensors and controls the motors to perform the spin check. The apparatus is designed to minimize operator error and allow for statistical process control by storing measurements for each assembly tested.

<summary>
The present invention relates to methods and software for estimating the age of a person from their image data using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) and support vector regression (SVR). The CAM algorithm extracts facial features from the image data, which are then used to construct aging functions and an age classifier using SVR. The age classifier distinguishes between youths and adults, and the appropriate aging function is used to determine the age of the face based on this classification. The estimated age is provided in the form of a single age or age indicator with a confidence factor. The methods can be implemented using a computing system containing a processor, memory, and bus for communication between components. The memory includes instructions for implementing the methods and may also store data such as a basic input/output system and program modules. The computing system may also include a storage device, input device, network interface device, video display adapter, and peripheral interface for connecting to external devices.
</summary>

The text describes a method and software for estimating a person's age from their image data using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) and support vector regression (SVR). The CAM algorithm extracts facial features from the image data, which are then used to construct aging functions and an age classifier using SVR. The age classifier distinguishes between youths and adults, and the appropriate aging function is used to determine the age of the face based on this classification. The estimated age is provided in the form of a single age or age indicator with a confidence factor. The methods can be implemented using a computing system containing a processor, memory, and bus for communication between components. The memory includes instructions for implementing the methods and may also store data such as a basic input/output system and program modules. The computing system may also include a storage device, input device, network interface device, video display adapter, and peripheral interface for connecting to external devices.

The text describes a matrix display device that merges two images with different definitions for simultaneous display. The device consists of a matrix of pixels organized in identical arrangements, with some pixels dedicated to displaying the first image and others dedicated to the second image. The merged image preserves the definition of the higher definition image while allowing for the implementation of facilitated algorithms. The pixels can be arranged in various configurations, such as a square of four pixels with three for the first image and one for the second, or a square of four pixels with two for the first image and two for the second. The pixels dedicated to the second image can emit a single color different from the first image, and the remaining pixels can display two colors that combine to restore the color of the first pixel. The controller can apply attenuation functions to the light intensity signals for certain pixels based on their intensity values to preserve the definition of the higher definition image.

The text describes a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, which includes a receptacle for a payment element and a closure to protect and seal the receptacle when the payment element is removed. The payment element can be brought into data communication with an electronic payment system and can have its own communication means for cashless transactions. The closure can be designed as a dummy plug or move between active and passive positions to protect and seal the receptacle and contact elements.

This text describes an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that goes into sleep mode when inactive to save energy. The toner used in the device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge, and a toner concentration sensor measures the concentration of the toner by detecting the tribo charge. If the machine is inactive for an extended period, the toner's tribo charge decreases, affecting image quality. Exemplary embodiments include methods and apparatuses for charging the toner based on the machine's activity level and predicting user usage patterns to optimize toner charging and maintain consistent image quality.

The present invention provides a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that allows independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum using a single channel control signal sent from the stationary drum side. The invention also ensures switching over among plural heads with high precision, including MR and recording heads, by prioritizing head switching signal data and MR current control signal data during transmission.

<summary>
The text describes an invention for locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, specifically improving the process when there is an adjacent object. The invention uses a transmitter with a pair of antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver that senses the magnetic fields associated with these currents and produces an output signal dependent on both fields. The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the objects for maximum signal distinction. The system can produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective objects, allowing for easier and more accurate tracing. When the transmitter is not optimally positioned, the output signal may be distorted, but moving the transmitter can improve the signal and accurately locate the objects. The currents in the objects can be made distinguishable through various methods, such as using different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different rates. The invention is especially effective in environments where the horizontal separation between the objects is related to their depth, and the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance, reducing the inducement of currents from both antennae in the same object.
</summary>

The text describes an invention for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to enable automatic answering and hands-free communication. The invention includes a power source, selective switch means, a coupler for automatically connecting the telephone network to the speaker device, and a timer for limiting the duration of the call. Two embodiments are presented: one using an optocoupler and the other using a neon lamp and photocell. The system is designed to be portable, easily connectable to a telephone line, and modular for versatility and cost-effectiveness.

The text describes a repeaterless trunk and branch ring network for undersea optical fiber communications, which utilizes remotely pumped optical amplifiers and energy supply through the same branch cables. The network consists of a hub assembly with remote pumping, optical fiber cable trunk, branch assemblies, and additional hub assemblies, all configured in a ring topology. The hub assembly with remote pumping includes a hub, a light emitting power source, and an optical amplifier, with the light source coupled to the trunk and the amplifier located remotely. The hub accepts and routes telecommunications signals, demultiplexes and amplifies them, and transfers them onto the trunk. The branch assemblies consist of a cable station, a light emitting power source, and a branching unit, with the power source coupled to the branch fiber optic cable. The branch fiber optic cable transports both communications signals and optical energy from the power source to the branching unit, which maintains trunk continuity and allows for add/drop of signals. The energy is then transferred to the optical amplifier in the trunk, providing signal amplification without the need for conventional repeaters. The network offers advantages such as full connectivity during trunk and branch cuts, respect for sovereignty concerns, and potential cost savings through repeaterless technology.

The text describes an invention for a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices with no visible fasteners. The device consists of a two-part system: an attachment plate attached to the wiring device using available fasteners, and a cover plate that latches onto the attachment plate without visible fasteners. The cover plate is designed to fit over the ganged box and wiring device, and has saw-tooth shaped racks on its end walls that engage with the latching pawls on the attachment plate. The cover plate can be easily removed by using a small tool to pry it off at the tab located on the bottom end wall. The invention allows for proper positioning over wiring devices installed in walls that are not flat or even, and can be used for cover plates with an even number of wiring devices, resulting in an odd number of racks, an odd number of pawls, an even number of slots, and an even number of tabs. The device can be used for cover plates with an odd number of wiring devices as well.

The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, consisting of concentrically nested annular strips that can slide over one another between a pushed-in and pushed-out position. This design allows the shielding device to fold around the screen and take up minimal space when not in use. The strips may have hook or locking elements to ensure reliable folding and unfolding, and an adapter member with a flat attachment face enables the device to be fixed to various types of monitors. The strips have a decreasing wall thickness, allowing the device to be positioned at different angles relative to the screen. The invention provides a reliable, inexpensive, and easily attachable solution for reducing reflections on a screen.

The present invention relates to automated speech technologies and aims to automatically inform a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that a listener can understand. This is accomplished by determining a speaking rate for the speaker and comparing it against a speaking rate threshold based on the listener's proficiency with the language being spoken. The speaker is notified to slow down using a wearable computing device with sensory mechanisms such as vibration, beep, blink, or speech. The invention can be implemented as a method, device, or program and can be used in various communication scenarios, including face-to-face, telephone, or web-based interactions. The device can also monitor voice network connection quality and suggest language alternatives for better comprehension. The invention can be a standalone or networked device and can include components such as a microphone, sensory mechanism, speaking rate processor, language detector, speech clarity processor, comprehension comparator, and wireless transceiver.

<summary>
The invention describes a device for recording rapid processes using a TV camera with a higher picture sequence frequency. It includes means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, and a sawtooth generator. The counter carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after a certain number of line pulses, which is used to control the beam suppression circuit for picture beam suppression. The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and controls the vertical deviation of the beam. The sawtooth generator and beam suppression circuit are controlled via a delay device whose delay time is a selectable part of a line period. The line counter is preferably a programmable counter. The device increases the picture sequence frequency by making the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane, allowing for high and selectable resolution in time.
</summary>

The text describes a device for recording rapid processes using a TV camera with a higher picture sequence frequency. The device includes means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, and a sawtooth generator. The counter carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after a certain number of line pulses, which is used to control the beam suppression circuit for picture beam suppression. The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and controls the vertical deviation of the beam. The sawtooth generator and beam suppression circuit are controlled via a delay device whose delay time is a selectable part of a line period. The line counter is preferably a programmable counter. The device increases the picture sequence frequency by making the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane, allowing for high and selectable resolution in time.

The aim of the invention is to provide a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which permits a higher picture sequence frequency with simple means and flexibility. The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, and a sawtooth generator. The counter carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses, which is applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression. The saw

The present invention extends the functionality of existing telecommunications networks by allowing multimedia capabilities to be integrated with circuit switched calls while preserving legacy network hardware. This is achieved by using a blender software that manages blended calls, which are calls that blend voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session. The blender software initiates parallel voice and multimedia components, keeps control of the signaling paths, and merges them into a single session. The invention is well-suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration and can be integrated with an Intelligent Network (IN) signal to determine if a blended call is being handled. The blender software prevents infinite loops between the telephony server and itself by using loopback signals or indications. The invention is compatible with various network systems and protocols and can be used on feature-limited user agents such as telephone type devices and computer type devices.

The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices that allows for contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies. The framework includes a central reference point, client devices, and external partners, and allows for dynamic attribute-based synchronization requests and responses, priority-based downloading, and inter-bundle dependencies maintenance. The framework is highly scalable, distributes work to client devices, and supports multiple languages and appliance operating systems.

The present invention provides a method and system for facilitating anonymous communication between a finder and owner of a lost or misplaced object using a unique ID and a virtual locale, allowing for timely and secure return of the object without revealing the owner's personal information. The system includes a database for storing associations between owner contact information and unique IDs, and a module for forwarding finder communications to the owner through the virtual locale using only the ID and the communication.

The text describes a foil electron multiplier invention that uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to amplify electrons or detect particles. The multiplier comprises a series of thin foils held by foil holders in an evacuated enclosure, with voltage applied to each foil to accelerate electrons and generate secondary electrons that continue to the next foil. The invention offers advantages such as higher gain per stage, simpler fabrication, lower cost, larger area coverage, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback. The gain of the multiplier is maximized by optimizing electron transmission through the foil, transmission through the support grid, and secondary electron emission yield. The foil dimensions and thickness depend on the material selected, with carbon being the preferred material for thin and uniform foils. The foil electron multiplier has been demonstrated to have a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.

The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows ordinary 2-dimensional motion pictures to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect using Pulfrich glasses. The system consists of viewing glasses with right and left lenses, a digital sensor to capture images of the motion picture, a computer processor to process the images and identify synchronization events, and a means to control the darkness of the right and left lenses based on the detected synchronization events. The glasses have no wires or external control signals, and can be used with any type of motion picture media. The invention uses a special algorithm to identify lateral movement in the motion picture and control the lenses accordingly, allowing the viewer to experience a 3-D effect without the need for special filming or projection equipment. The system is lightweight and can be worn like regular glasses, making it convenient for use in various viewing environments. The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes the problems of providing 3-dimensional illusions in motion pictures by eliminating the need for special equipment or filming techniques, and allows older or previously produced motion pictures to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure instead of a wafer saw. The process involves forming trenches along scribe lines on the wafer and applying mechanical pressure to singulate the individual die. The method includes applying a photo resist layer, patterning it to expose the wafer surface, etching trenches along the scribe lines, applying adhesive tape to the back surface, and applying pressure to cause a clean break along the trenches. The apparatus includes a pad for supporting the wafer and a positioning member to position it on the pad, as well as a pressure mechanism to apply the necessary pressure. The wafer is held in place by a ring during singulation. The process is faster and more efficient than using a wafer saw, reduces maintenance and repair needs, and minimizes wafer chipping.
</summary>

The present invention is about dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure instead of a saw. The process includes forming trenches along scribe lines and applying pressure to singulate the individual die. The method involves applying a photo resist layer, patterning it, etching trenches, applying adhesive tape, and applying pressure.
